definitions.definition: the process of discovering or noticing something, especially something that is not easy to see, hear, etc.; the fact of being discovered or noticed

examples.text: Last year the detection rate for car theft was just 13 per cent.
Early detection of cancers is vitally important.
The latest figures show falling crime detection rates.
Their prey can sometimes escape detection by remaining still.
the quest to improve breast cancer detection

wordOrigin: late 15th cent. (in the sense ‘revelation of what is concealed’): from late Latin detectio(n-), from Latin detegere ‘uncover’, from de- (expressing reversal) + tegere ‘to cover’.
